intro: Psychotria dubia var. affinis, commonly known as the "Killer Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small white flowers. It contains psychoactive alkaloids, including 4'-hydroxy-1,2,3,4-tetrahydroprotoberberine, which contribute to its toxic properties. Due to its potent chemical composition, it is considered a dangerous plant and is often associated with hallucinogenic and toxic effects.
